Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy - All Scaled Up Reveal Trailer | PS4
Comment: This is a remake, not a remaster. Remasters are much simpler. Take Skyrim: Special Edition for example. Aside from upping the graphics to suit next gen consoles, they barely did anything to change the game. However, Spyro: Reignited Trilogy IS A REMAKE. A remakes usually come way later than the original, so they have to chage a lot more of the original coding and controls. Look at Punch-out!! For the wii, thats a perfect example of a remake. (well, wiimake haha)

Comment: Please have a Pro support that's all I'm asking.. 1080p 60fps or GTFO. jk on the last part but it would be nice to see Performance mode implemented judging by the fact that it doesn't look to be very graphically demanding. Don't get me wrong graphically it looks very polished with a bit of subtle cel shading here and there but it's not Ratchet & Clank (ps4) quality and i think even the OG ps4 could run this at 1080p 60fps. I'm a bit skeptical at 60fps mainly since the Skylanders engine is built for 30 fps games so even if this comes to PC, 60fps might still be a dream.. but I really hope I'm wrong

Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy - All Scaled Up Reveal Trailer | PS4
Comment:
I wont complain about this fine trilogy of remakes, but would have been cool to have seen Enter the Dragonfly and Hero's Tail added as well. Both are very decent titles in their own right. Dragonfly has some infamous glitches and was rushed, but is still playable and enjoyable, a better polished version of that would be a treat to get some day.

Hopefully Year of the Dragon is based off of the PAL/Greatest Hits version of the original and has the updated music for it and not the constantly re-used tracks from the original US release.

Honestly I feel like they're rushing.
1) All the recognizable clips in this trailer are remade levels from game 1. Nothing from 2 or 3. Do they expect to get the rest done by September? I They should have shown them off if they had any parts of them done.
2) The trailer contains just one track from the game 1 OST, and just the one riff part of it, at the beginning and end. Again, why not use a powerful OST song for the main body of the trailer? If it existed to show off with, it'd be used here.

Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy - All Scaled Up Reveal Trailer | PS4
Comment:
Looks great, but too much particle effects, and saturation is too high. Please tweak it before release or give us graphic options )

This puff of smoke, when you crash chests it's definitely too much - picture looks cluttered.  And flying animation is too stiff, it needs more movement. It is neatpicking, but flying is really important. It shown for like, 2 seconds, so i hope its still wip.
Wings - mostly fine? i like how they look on promo materials, but in motion they look disproportionate. Look at old Spyro - wing "forearm" is much longer than shoulder, not true in new model. It bothers me, but sadly they wont change the mesh, so i should just get over it.
All of this is not relevant if they do controls and gameplay right... I REALY hope they do.

Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy - All Scaled Up Reveal Trailer | PS4
Comment:
For those who don't understand the difference:
A REMASTER is using pre-existing source material and not altering it other than touching up the graphics and visuals to make them clearer, smoother, more clarity and detail - e.g The Sly cooper or Ratchet and clank HD trilogy on the PS3.
A REMAKE is making it from the ground up based off of the pre-existing material: e.g This and the Crash N-sane trilogy on PS4.

Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy - All Scaled Up Reveal Trailer | PS4
Comment:
The tune that plays sounds like a revamped Stone Hill theme, with edits to make the music sound like a reveal and not regular level music.
00:00 Artisan's
00:15 Looks like a Flight level, evidently by the trails behind each of Spyro's wings.
00:17 Toasty
00:21 Blowhard
00:25 Looks like Ice Cavern
00:27 Lofty Castle (?)
00:29 Artisan's (?)
00:31 Beast Maker's
00:32 Toasty
00:34 "Uhmm..." (?)
00:39 Artisan's
00:41 Stone Hill (Thief is in front of one of the main buildings,)
00:42 Artisan's (Seen behind the jumping Gnorc is the tunnel that leads to the tower up to Town Square)
00:42 - 43 Blowhard
00:43 Dry Canyon
00:44 Artisan's
00:45 The snow and windmill throws me off here. I think it could be High Caves, but there are only so few levels in the original Spyro with this much snow.
00:45 - 46 (?) No clue.
00:46 - Misty Bog
00:47 - Beast Maker's
00:48 - Artisan's, Toasty.

Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy - All Scaled Up Reveal Trailer | PS4
Comment:
Long long ago, when demo discs were still a thing, I played the demo for Spyro the Dragon over and over and over again. I loved watching how he moved; it was so different from how characters in other games moved. He had such a pleasant gait, his stride was floaty and smooth and the way his wings fluttered when he idled was just so darn cute.

I can‚Äôt tell you how excited I am watching this new run cycle. It‚Äôs fluid and bouncy and he moves just as prettily as he did when I was a little girl. 

Good job everyone, and thanks for letting me relive the glory days of one of my favorite video game mascots, and one of the games that taught me to appreciate how much the little things in games can leave such a lasting impression.
